p: Whole blood (ca. 0.5â€“2 ml) was collected in K 2EDTA tubes (BD Vacutainer, Becton, Dickinson and Company, Franklin Lakes, NJ). As part of the initial diagnostic evaluation, plasma was screened for CHIKV viral RNA (vRNA) by molecular methods [ 13, 14]. All virus isolations and RNA extractions on CHIKV-positive specimens were performed in a BSL-3 facility at the University of Florida (UF) Emerging Pathogens Institute in Gainesville, Florida.
